title: Is Ade Edmondson’s character Daniel Cook dead in EastEnders?
text:
Could this be the end for Daniel? (Picture: Kieron McCarron/BBC)

Tonight’s EastEnders is set to be an emotional one as Jean Slater (Gillian Wright) will discover Daniel Cook (Ade Edmondson) has died.

The couple had bonded in the cancer ward over the last few months, despite initially being at loggerheads due to Daniel’s cynicism.

The devastating news will hit Jean particularly hard after Daniel admitted his feelings for her just last week, with the pair even sharing a kiss.

So, what led up to Daniel’s tragic departure and what is his story so far?

Daniel first appeared on EastEnders on 25 June where he was seen at Walford General being difficult with the nurses.

He and Jean initially got off to a rocky start when he rubbed her up the wrong way with offensive remarks, however the pair got over their differences as they started to see each other more and more at the ward, while being treated for cancer.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Earlier this month Daniel revealed his cancer had returned and was terminal, leading Jean to promise to take care of him.

Daniel’s EastEnders career was short-lived (Picture: BBC/Jack Barnes)

However these plans look as though they will be tragically cut short.

In tonight’s episode, Jean is expecting to inform Stacey about her blossoming romance with Daniel when she suddenly receives a call from his neighbour to inform her that he has passed away.

You’ll have to tune in to see how Jean reacts…

EastEnders continues tonight at 8pm on BBC One.

MORE: EastEnders spoilers: Jean Slater struggles to cope with Daniel Cook’s death tonight

description: Daniel had recently been diagnosed with terminal cancer.
